Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • Terrain

  • public class Terrain
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Jon on 3/31/15. Creates terrain with dryness and rivers and continually updates self 0 - Not burning 1 - Burning 2 - empty/burnt 3-Water

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Terrain(int c, int r, double wD, double wS)
      Initializes terrain with given values, converts wind direction from degrees to radians, calculates x and y speed based of wind direction and speed Sets canvas size and scale

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void drawRiver()
      Draws a river Chooses random starting position on the x axis Will find random points and connect with water to give appearance of random river
      int getStatus(int x, int y)
      returns cell status
      double getTempDry(int x, int y)
      returns cell dryness level
      double getXSpeed()
      returns x speed between 0 and 1
      double getYSpeed()
      returns y speed between 0 and 1
      void initalizeDryness(double drynessLevel)
      initialized dryness based on given dryness level Will randomly select point on graph and increase the dryness of cells in a randomly chosen radius The higher the dryness level the more dry
      void setTempDryness(int x, int y, double dryness)
      Changes temp cell dryness level
      void setTempStatus(int x, int y, int status)
      Changes temporary cell status
      void update()
      Updates cell colors based on temp status and updates real status If cell is burt a margin is applied to prevent visible grid lines If cell is still forest will set color to a shade of green based on dryness level

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Terrain

        public Terrain(int c,
               int r,
               double wD,
               double wS)
        Initializes terrain with given values, converts wind direction from degrees to radians, calculates x and y speed based of wind direction and speed Sets canvas size and scale
        Parameters:
        c - - columns
        r - - rows
        wD - - wind direction
        wS - - wind speed

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates cell colors based on temp status and updates real status If cell is burt a margin is applied to prevent visible grid lines If cell is still forest will set color to a shade of green based on dryness level

      • drawRiver

        public void drawRiver()
        Draws a river Chooses random starting position on the x axis Will find random points and connect with water to give appearance of random river

      • initalizeDryness

        public void initalizeDryness(double drynessLevel)
        initialized dryness based on given dryness level Will randomly select point on graph and increase the dryness of cells in a randomly chosen radius The higher the dryness level the more dry
        Parameters:
        drynessLevel - - between 0 and 1

      • setTempStatus

        public void setTempStatus(int x,
                          int y,
                          int status)
        Changes temporary cell status
        Parameters:
        x - - column value
        y - - row value
        status - - status you want to set given cell

      • setTempDryness

        public void setTempDryness(int x,
                           int y,
                           double dryness)
        Changes temp cell dryness level
        Parameters:
        x - - column value
        y - - row value
        dryness - - dryness value
